captions.text:
‒  Here you go.
‒  Thanks.

‒  Here you go.
‒  Thanks.
Well? Shall we toast the rain?
I don’t like rain. I’ll drink, though.
Ilya Glinnikov
Yana Sobolevskaya
“A Business-Plan That Works”. May I?
If you wish.
I see… The theory of pride…
Andrei Kronglevskiy
What kind of a theory is that?

‒  Are you really interested?
‒  I am.
Yanina Sokolova

For example… Did you have
toys in your childhood?
I did.

Here is an example. When a
kid is five, he receives a toy.

Let it be some simple bunny. The
child is happy. He stays happy for long

and doesn’t ask for more toys because…
he just doesn’t need other toys.

And another child gets a lot of toys.
It seems to him that the more toys he has

the happier he becomes.
In reality, it’s only an illusion.

I don’t know. It’s weird.
I had many toys in my childhood
but I fell for each new one.
I see.
Based on Nicolay Polyakov’s novel
Margarita?
Wait! Don’t go!

What do you want from me?
Do you want sex?
Why do you say so?

Why not? What did you ask
to sit with me for, then?

Viktor means the “victorious”.
You’re a winner, aren’t you?
You’re an interesting woman.
Let’s go.
THE GUITAR LESSONS
Episode 2

‒  Lock the door.
‒  What?
Please lock the door. Come in.
Directed by Vladimir Yanoschuk

‒  Undress.
‒  Just so?

‒  Is something wrong?
‒  It is.
Created by Alina Semeryakova

You may turn the lights
off, if you want to.
Music by Nikita Yanoschuk
Margarita, what is going on with you?

Director of Photography
– Vadim Savitskiy
Shall we sing a song?

Art Directors – Alexander
Kononov, Natalia Kononova
Hello?
OK. Thanks. Good night.
Sound Director – Andrei Starikovskiy

All flights have been cancelled
until tomorrow morning.
Executive Producer – Dmitry Olenitch
Margarita, shall I help you?

Produced by Galina
Bilan-Timkina and Vlad Ryashin

‒  Shall we go?
‒  Where to?
For a walk.
It’s raining.
We may have a walk in the rain.

‒  Well…
‒  It’s a real shower!

‒  Do you have an umbrella?
‒  Me? No. Do you have one?
We’ll solve this problem now.
Can you find an umbrella for us?

‒ How much?
‒ 5 dollars.
No. 5 dollars isn’t enough. Ten will do.

‒  Can you do it?
‒  I can.

‒  OK. Just be quick.
‒  OK.
The problem is solved.

‒  Yes.
‒  Yes.
Well? Where shall we go?

It doesn’t matter. There are 6
hours until the morning. At least.

We’ll head in different
directions after that.
Everything will be as it used to be.

However, we may spend
this night as we want to.

‒  Let’s go.
‒  Yes.
They are leaving! Faster! Look there!
Hey, friend! Stop!

‒  Are they calling for us?
‒  They are.

‒  Where did you get this umbrella?
‒  I bought it.
Come here and tell me where you bought it!

You come her, and I’ll
tell you where I bought it!
Why are you laughing? Come here!
Don’t your legs hurt?

‒ They don’t.
‒  Let’s run!
Come here, now!
Shall we toast our meeting once more?
Clyde.
Bonnie.
When did you last have a walk in the rain?
I don’t remember.

Do you see?
The night promises to be interesting.
It’s weird.
What is weird?
Everything is weird. It’s very weird.
The flight was cancelled. We’re here.
We don’t know each other.
Why? I know you.

You have a small enterprise.
A good apartment.
And a husband on a sofa.

Why did you marry him? You
don’t remember it yourself.
He allows you to sweat your guts out.

You don’t have any free time. When
you have it, you take your daughter

to the toy shop. It’s because you’re
never home and you feel bad about it.

So, you buy her
everything that she wants.
Am I right?

Almost. I think
I know something about you too.
How interesting!

You’re a doctor. You’re not well paid
but you love your job.

When you patients bring you some gratitude,
you blush.

However, you accept
it because you have a wife

and two kids at home. A boy and a girl.
Your wife is getting on your nerves

all the time because she never has
enough. The children love you, though.
Sometimes you go on a business trip

and try to forget your real life.
Is that so?

Almost. How did
you guess that I was a doctor?

I saw your hands. I’m
almost a doctor myself.

I have a small
pharmaceutical enterprise.

‒ We’re colleagues, aren’t we?
‒  We are.
Answer the phone.

The thunderstorm passed. The
flights must have resumed.
Viktor. Answer the phone.

‒ I won’t go.
‒  What will happen next?

‒ Different variants are possible.
‒  Answer the phone.
Yes? Good morning. Yes, thanks.
One moment.
I have a suggestion…

He looked at me so suspiciously.
I thought: “What is going on”?

‒ I know.
‒  He was with his wife.

‒ And with a girlfriend…
‒  What did you do?

‒ I thought that she was his wife!
‒  Stop it!
I’m serious! Why not?
I beg your pardon.

I asked you not to call me at
work. I can’t talk right now.

Volodya, listen… I’ll
come home and we’ll talk.
Sorry. Did you see a girl from Room 39?

She left. Pack your things;
your departure is soon.

‒ Where did she go?
‒  I don’t know. Hurry up.

Without promises, life is sadder
than a rainy night without any light.

Don’t spare the promises,
don’t be afraid to lie to me.

There are so many
troubles and everyday ado.

Don’t be afraid to say beautiful
meaningless words
that live for no longer than the flowers.
People’s hearts look forward to them.

The world is so empty without
them. There is truth in them

for the short time
while they’re blooming.
Hi.
What has happened?
Was it good?
What do you mean?

Oleg, hurry up, please.
A taxi is waiting for us.
Yeah...
Oleg, do you hear me?
Nastya, shall I really go there?

Look, nobody is interested in that
ancient story. It’s long forgotten.
I didn’t mean it.

Of course you didn’t. Believe
me, Sveta doesn’t care about you.
Even more so. Why shall I go there?
Don’t forget the flowers.
Our beauty is having rest.

Of course she is! After
such an important event!

‒ Martha! Martha!
‒  Sveta! Hi! Here you go!

‒ It’s great that you came, Martha!
‒  Natalia Mikhaylovna, hello.

‒ I’m glad to see you, Martha!
‒  Please meet Valera.

‒  Valera, this is Martha.
‒  Nice to meet you.

Martha, nice to meet you.
This is for you. Congratulations!

‒  Thank you very much!
‒  Who is it?

‒  Irina.
‒  Irina Valeryevna. My honey!

Martha, I’m sorry… You
said that you wouldn’t come.
Therefore, I invited Nastya…

‒  No problem.
‒  No problem? Very good!
Thanks.
I’ll catch up with you.
Here we go.

‒ Oh, Nastya!
‒  I’ll make a quick call.

‒  Sure. Hi.
‒  Hi.

– Congratulations!
‒  Thanks.

‒  Valeriy.
‒  Anastasiya.

‒ Nice to meet you.
‒  Nice to meet you too.
Did you come alone?

‒  No, I’m with Oleg.
‒  With Oleg…

He is smoking. He’ll
come up in a moment.

‒ Do you recognize Martha?
‒  How nice she is! Hi!

‒ Martha!
‒  Ivashova?

‒  Nastya? Hi.
‒  Long time no see!

‒ I wouldn’t recognize you.
‒  Yes.

‒ Hello.
‒  Hello.

‒  Very good.
‒ Sveta?
Let’s go, honey. The priest is waiting.
We’re coming, mum.

‒ Let’s go, girls.
‒  Let’s go!
You’re so nice, Ira!

‒ Will you buy some candles?
‒  Sure, I will.

‒ Did you buy napkins?
‒ Of course, I did.
Good.

Look to your left. Do you see a girl
with a candle? Do you recognize her?
Who is she?

She is your beloved.
Didn’t you recognize her?

‒ What money can do!
‒  What money?

Huge money. She must have
undergone a plastic surgery.

Glorify our Father the God here
now and for the eternity. Amen!

Sveta is such a fool but
she found her happiness too.
Why is she a fool?

I don’t envy her. However, have such
a huge house just for the three of them?
They will probably have more kids.
People live happily! They have kids…

‒ Who made you make abortions?
‒  You’re a bastard!

It’s great that you came. I’m
very glad to see you, honestly!
I’m very glad for you, honestly.

We live in one city but we don’t
meet. Life is so weird…
It is.

My back breaks. I’ll go and
put her in her cradle.
Go.
She is sleeping.

I didn’t know that you and
Nastya still communicate.

We have common patients so we have
to. She isn’t bad. She is just unhappy.

Do you understand? Just forgive
them and forget! Live your own life!
Live the moment! Do you hear me?

‒ Shall we drink something?
‒  We shall.

‒ We shall, shan’t we?
‒  We shall.

What juice would you life?
Apple or orange? Champagne?

‒  Yes.
‒ I knew it! Watch yourself!
Hush, hush…

…I feel pains in the chest. My heart
aches. Maybe I shall quit smoking.
Or… what is going on? Will you help me?

I beg your pardon… Who told
you that I was a doctor?

People say so. May it be
something to do with my karma?
Mum? Mum? Mum? Is everything fine?

It is. Come to the guests for a
moment. Let Martha watch over the baby.
Yes, sure.

Hello. Let me offer you a
light. You’re a charming girl.
I felt an urge to come up to you…
Sorry. I’ll come back in a moment.
She isn’t sleeping, is she?

Have you been communicating
with Sveta all this time?

You’re right. No matter what I say
now, it’ll sound like some nonsense.

‒  Did you come to the city long ago?
‒  Why?

‒  I was looking for you.
‒  You were looking for a different woman.

I was looking for you. Then,
after what happened… I wanted…
Hello!
Hush, hush.

‒  How are you doing? Is everything OK?
‒  Her nappy needs changing.
Let me do it.

‒  I wanted to…
‒  Give her to me…

I… I didn’t recognize you.
I mean I recognized you.

It wasn’t an accident that we
stayed in that hotel on that day.

We had a walk in the rain; we kissed.
Maybe it was one more chance.

Since than… Nastya and I… we’ve
been living like some criminals.
12 years… and nothing…
But for work…
Come here…
Let me go!
A bed! Just what we need!

What? What are you staring at?
Get lost! Or else I’ll go out and…
Hey?
Hello?
Wrong number.

I am sure you won’t
regret your decision.

I liked the financing very much.
I think that project will be great.

‒ I hope so. Good luck!
‒  Good luck.

‒  Good‒ bye.
‒  Good‒ bye.
Listen to me! Don’t get mad!
Just one question, and I’ll leave.
Will you present me to your husband?
Will you present me to your kids?

‒ I have no kids.
‒  You have a wife.

I hope she is happy with her new
chosen one. I’ll get to know the details
at the court hearing during the divorce.

Did you want to say or to ask
something?

‒  To ask.
‒  Well?

‒ Is there a chance?
‒  A chance of what?
Of you forgiving me.

‒ I wonder when we’re given up for lost.
‒  We’ll hear that.

‒ They’ll try to break in.
‒  They will.

We won’t let anybody in.
We’ll barricade the doors.
Do you have tinned food?
We have water. We’ll survive.

We’ll get enough sleep to
last for a hundred years.
What will we eat when we’re out of food?
I’ll go out. And find something.
No. I won’t let you go anywhere.
Where are you going?
To the court. Today is the last hearing.

Here you go. This is for you.
He is my deputy.
I love you.
I love you too.
I’ll be quick.
Yes. I love you too. Yes. OK.
Hello? Yes.
He is my husband, yes.
What has happened?

‒  What are you doing here?
‒  We delivered the furniture.

‒  Will it take long?
‒  It will.

‒ What room is Markov in?
‒  Markov? He in the 14th. Follow me.

‒ Are you his wife?
‒  I am.

A fit of stenocardia, and he lost his
consciousness. It’s not dangerous as it is.
Take it, please.

The problem is that he
hurt his head when falling.
He has an internal brain injury.

It’s hard to foretell
an outcome at the moment.
A man is waiting for you in the hall.

‒ Hello.
‒  Hello.
How is he?

It’s all right, he’ll be fine.
We should be!
Who are you?

Pasha the taxi driver. I drove him this
morning to the court… and then here.

You won’t believe it, but I’ve never
seen a happier passenger in my life.

He talked a lot, he was laughing
all the time. He was so happy!

I asked him why he was so happy and he
told me that he was going to divorce.

I asked him what there was
to be happy about and he said

that we was going to get married at
once. We dropped into a jewelry shop

and he boasted his purchase to me.
We went to the court then.
He asked me to wait for me.
I saw him ascending the stairs.

He stopped to have a smoke.
Then he turned, smiled,
waved his hands and fell down.
I called the ambulance.
This must be for you.
I agree.

‒ Hello.
‒  Hello, beauty.
Hello. Hello.

‒ Auntie Valya, good afternoon.
‒  Hello.
This is for you. This is for you too.

Martha, you’re shining
today. Is it some holiday?
It is a holiday.
Yes, come in!
Hello.
My love! She came as if from a dream!
Martha came to me!
Of course I did!

‒ Hello.
‒  How could I not come, grandpa?

‒ What are you doing?
‒  Why aren’t you eating?
I’m not a grandpa!

‒  Did you eat my stuffed cabbages?
‒  I did.
You ate all of them! Very good, grandpa!

A “grandpa” again! I’m
Grandpa for my grandchildren.
However, for you I’m Nicolay…
Petrovitch.

Martha, you’re so beautiful!
My soul longs to you!
I’ll go. My husband is waiting for me.
He is happy. If he only knew…
He knows.
Hi. Happy birthday.

You can’t imagine what day I had!
A real holiday! Not a single traffic jam!
I came here so quickly!

Everybody must have left…
for their summer cottages.

Poplar fluff is everywhere.
People get mad but I like it; I’m happy.

Sparrows wallow in the dust.
I think a thunderstorm is imminent.

Grandpa Kolya is being
discharged. It’s good, isn’t it?
It’s high time we’re discharged too.
By the way, Sveta sends hello to you.

So, get up! Your patients are waiting
for you. I don’t even want to think
about what is going on in my office.

All my employees must
be having a great time.

Viktor Pavlovitch,
let’s go out. One moment.

Viktor Pavlovitch, it seems to me…
sometimes I feel… no, I know that…

He can hear me. He hears me and reacts
to me. I can see that he is thinking.

Sometimes it seems to me
that he is smiling. It’s true!

Martha, you shall have rest.
And have a good sleep.
Thank you!
How are you? Is everything fine?

They tell me to go home.
As if I don’t want to go home!
How can I go there, though?

That hare is sitting there
staring at me. And your pillow...
Why did I let you go?

I’m sitting alone on a hill, among
spring bogs, and I love your eyes

that are bitter like bark of
young asps. I love your dear smile

and lips dried by the wind.
Therefore, I take you everywhere I go.

I am telling you about everything and
I’m talking to you about everything.

I show you the first lily of the
valley and give you a pink cone…

Why didn’t they change your
sheets? One moment. Wait a bit!

…I’m catching the glimpse of
stars. You think that I’m a stranger

who is so far away from you.
You think that I don’t care

about your chilly soul.
It have gotten dark and cold;

the hedgehogs are rustling in the
grass. One can’t even see grass

in the dark night. Hug me,
my dear, we’re homeless souls.

She used to look after him. She
almost lived in one room with him.

Then she felt unwell. She was
taken to a different clinic.

And he came to his senses.
He is lying here all alone.

It’s good that we found him.
This room is the 14th.
She used to call herself his wife.

‒ Thanks. What was her name?
‒  Martha.
Oleg?
Thanks God! At last!
You scared me so much!
The doctors said that you would die.

Nobody believed but I did.
I was waiting…
every day and every hour.

I’ve been waiting for two
months. Here. By your side.
Do you hear me? We’ll go home soon.
Natasha?

You said that our baby died.
Rita won’t bear such a loss.

Her daughter died right after she
gave birth. You were in prison;

I didn’t have any money, I didn’t
have a place to live, so I left…
How are you doing, escapee?

– She is quiet today.
– She cried again at night.

This is bad. I would understand it
if you were a silly girl but you…

‒ You shouldn’t move.
‒  I shall go.

I won’t discharge you before you
undergo the entire treatment course.
In a month. Maybe.
You have no right. You must discharge me…

on my own free will.
I’ll sign all the papers.

We’ll see what rights I have.
And now go to sleep.
Sleep and sleep!

‒ Girls, in case of anything…
‒  Don’t worry. She won’t escape.

‒ It’s too late. He has been discharged.
‒  When?
A week ago. His wife took him home.

‒  What wife?
‒  His real wife.
This is your year. A graduation ball.
Your friends Garik, Adrenalin.

Do you remember? Well…
they came for our wedding.
I’ll show you our wedding photos now.

‒ Who are they?
‒  These are my fellow students.
This is me.

‒ Who is by your side?
‒  This is Sveta. Do you remember her?

‒ Who is Sveta?
‒  Here she is.
Who is it?

I don’t remember. She studied with
us and left after one semester…

‒ She was often sick.
‒  What is her name?

I don’t remember. Maybe Mar… Masha.
Yes, I think he name was Masha.

She waited for you for the entire evening
and you’re saying that you were busy.
Couldn’t you have called?
Can I?
Don’t I have anything better to do?
Mum, look at this beautiful hare!

Let’s go! Pick her up
today, as you promised!
Seven Years Later

The shunts have been sewn
together and are functional now.

Let’s finish with him.
Stop the heart‒ lung machine.
It has been stopped.

‒ May I leave the auricle?
‒  You may.
Pincers. Scissors.

I’m leaving the auricle.
It’s bleeding. Pull harder.

‒ I’m pulling. It doesn’t work.
‒  Stop the bleeding.

Make a plastic on the auricle.
There is an abscess here. Hold this.
I’m holding.

‒ Oleg Petrovitch, what’s wrong with you?
‒  Finish with him.

‒ Do you feel unwell?
‒  Finish the surgery!
What is it?

This is my leave statement.
Sign it, please.

No, no, Oleg. I won’t sign
it! There is no way I’ll do it!

We almost lost a patient
because of me today.

Look, Oleg, you’re a serious surgeon.
You said that we almost lost him.

However, we didn’t! Plus…
who will I stay here with?

You know well that you can
do things that others can’t!

Thanks God you were there today!
What if I faint during the surgery?
The process has started!
Look, Oleg, don’t panic. Do an examination.

Then come back and take your
statement away. Is it a deal?
Very good!

‒  Yasha, don’t beat about the bush.
‒  It’s growing.
I can see it myself.

You have little time, Oleg. You need a
surgery. No, no, I won’t risk doing it.

Nobody here will. You need a
surgery abroad. It means money.
Yes, money.

‒ Yakov Semenovitch, we’re ready.
‒  Yes, sure. One minute.
Yes, honey.

Sure. I miss you very much too.
Yes, it’s true.

I’ll call you back. Somebody
is ringing at the door.

Did you forget your key? What has
happened? Was the surgery cancelled?
No. Why?

‒  How did it go?
‒  It went.

I’m leaving soon.
I have a driving lesson.

By the way, the instructor praised
me. Do you know whom I met today?

Yasha… Adrenalin. Your friend.
You should have seen his new car!
It’s a super…

Oleg, brace yourself! One
can’t look at you without tears!
I’m telling you that as a psychologist.
Can I have a charger?
Sure.
Damn it!

‒ Where are you going?
‒  Thanks.

‒ Well…
‒  Oleg?

You may do what you
want with the apartment.
Why now? Why not a month or a year ago?
I should have left earlier.

A toilet and a bathroom.
A room is small but cozy.

You may only smoke on the
balcony. Don’t move the furniture.
Don’t make noise. Read it!
I believe you. May I have a pen?
And as for the women, Markov…

‒  Don’t worry.
‒  Sign it.

‒ Oleg Petrovitch?
‒  How is the boy?

‒ Thanks God, he came to his senses.
‒  Stepanovna!

‒  Let’s go, faster!
‒  You’ll hug me to death!

‒  Hi.
‒  Hi.

‒  What is your name?
‒  Oleg.

My name is Oleg too. It means we’re
namesakes. How are you feeling?

‒  What about you?
‒  I’m fine.
You look sick.

‒  My honey! How are you?
‒  Fine.

‒  How is he?
‒  Everything is fine.
You did well.

I didn’t understand. He was
operated on and… what now?

Our suspicions that he had a
Fallot’s tetrad were confirmed.

We corrected the defect
of the ventricle and septum

and made a plastic surgery
of the right heart ventricle.

He’ll be kept in the emergency
room for a day and then we’ll see.

Don’t worry. He did very
well. His heart is strong.

If you need me, I’ll
be in the doctor’s room.

Oleg? Oleg? Sonny,
what is going on? Oleg?

Without promises, life is sadder
than a rainy night without any light.

Don’t spare the promises,
don’t be afraid to lie to me.

There are so many
troubles and everyday ado.

Don’t be afraid to say beautiful
meaningless words
that live for no longer than the flowers.
People’s hearts look forward to them.

The world is so empty without
them. There is truth in them

for the short time
while they’re blooming.

There is truth in them for the
short time while they’re blooming.

‒ Where did you hear this song?
‒  Mum taught it to me.

‒ Does she sing it often?
‒  She does.

‒ What about your dad?
‒  He doesn’t live with us.
Tokha, give me some chewing gum!

‒  I won’t!
‒  You’re so greedy!

‒ What?
‒  Is Oleg my son?
No, he is not.

‒ I’m serious.
‒  No.

‒  Hi.
‒  Hi.

Give me the key from
the car. I need it very much.
They say you left your job.
Hello? Yes.
I’ll come soon.
I can’t talk now.
I’ll call you back a bit later. Bye.
What is it?

When you start the engine,
the first gear is hard to move.

So start from the second one,
and then go back to the first.

‒ Oleg…
‒  Nastya, I have a headache, that’s all.
I’m sorry.

‒ So what? I want it! Mum! Please!
‒  Stop it.

‒ Happy New Year!
‒  Happy New Year!

‒ Mum, please, let’s go!
‒  They didn’t invite us. Did they?

‒ Mum, he said we could come!
‒  Take your wet mittens off!

‒ Mum please!
‒  Stop moaning! This conversation is over.
Let’s go, Oleg.

‒  Hello.
‒  Hello.
I’ve come to you.
What for?

‒ We need to talk.
‒  I’m all ears.
I saw Oleg today. He is very ill.
What is it?
Cancer.

We divorced. I have a
different life. With a different man.
I can’t help him.

When he came to his senses
in the hospital, I told him

that it was me who was by
his side all that time.
What for?
I was afraid to stay alone.
All right. Thanks! Oleg, let’s go!
Happy New Year!

‒  Shall we go to Olenitch?
‒  Yes! Dimon?

‒ Let’s go!
‒  Come on!

‒  Hi.
‒  Hello.

‒  Igor Petrovitch, what’s wrong with him?
‒  What?
I asked you what was wrong with him?

He is under anesthetic.
He is still sleeping.
It’s scary to look at him.

‒ Do you remember yourself after a surgery?
‒  I’ve forgotten about it.

‒ Take him in, guys!
‒ Good luck!
Move it!

‒  Garik? Thank you, Garik!
‒  Watch over him!
I will!

After the examination come
to my office please.
I will.
German fits you well. Hello, Margo.
I’m glad to see you. Let’s go.

‒  How are you?
‒  We’re managing.
Come in.
This is the reception hall of Queen Margo!
Stop it!

‒  You have a nice belt, Yasha.
‒  This one? A patient gave it to me.

Shall we get down to business?
The clinic received the money
except for 10,000 but it’s my problem.
Professor Mayer will operate on him.

We’ll start as soon as we
get the results of his tests.
Has she come?
She is on her way.

What a weird dream!
Garik, Adrenalin and you.
Be quiet. Spare your strength.
Go further.

‒  Hi.
‒  Hi, Margo.

‒  Hello.
‒  Hi.

‒  How was your flight?
‒  Everything is fine.

‒  Yasha?
‒  Hi.
Dad, hold on!

I have no words. To sell the enterprise,
the car, the apartment, everything…
It’s a deed only our people are capable of.
It’s time to go. Go further!

‒  I’m sorry.
‒  We’re waiting for you.
God help you!
Klaus, I’ll be very late tonight.
I have a difficult surgery.
Kiss Clara from me.
Good night. I kiss you.
Look. There is a finger. One moment. No.

You know that there is nothing here
too. Look! There is nothing here!

Do you see? Uncle
Yasha, show me a trick!
Look here. One finger, two fingers and…
Here you go… be careful…
Bum! Good boy!
Good…
How are they?
They are sleeping.

‒  Is everything fine?
‒  It is.

‒  I’ll go, then.
‒  Are you going home? OK.
Bye.
Thank you… for Oleg and for everything.

‒ Bye.
‒ Bye.

Be quiet, be quiet… It’s all right.
Calm down, everything is fine.

I found the doctors.
They did what they could…

‒  Everything is fine…
‒  I remember him so…

Don’t cry, don’t cry. Everybody
is alive; everybody is healthy.
They are sleeping. Hush, hush…
Let’s go.
Fly! Let’s run! Fly!
Hold it!
Go forward!
Dad, faster!

title: Обучаю Игре на Гитаре / Guitar Lessons. Фильм. 2 Серия. StarMedia. Фильмы о Любви. Мелодрама. 2012
